Prerequisites: APPROPRIATE PLACEMENT SCORES OR SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION OF COLLEGE PREP COURSES.
Course Description:
A STUDY OF ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS FOR SERVICE AND MERCHANDISING BUSINESSES, MATCHING CONCEPT, ADJUSTING PROCESS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, ACCOUNTING SYSTEMS, INTERNAL CONTROLS, RECEIVABLES, INVENTORIES, PAYROLL, PLANT ASSETS, INTANGIBLE ASSETS, CURRENT LIABILITIES, BONDS PAYABLE, AND CORPORATE: ORGANIZATION, EQUITY RIGHTS, AND EARNINGS.
THIS COURSE ALSO HELPS DEVELOP THE GENERAL EDUCATION OUTCOMES OF (1) CRITICAL/CREATIVE THINKING; (2) COMMUNICATION; (3) CULTURAL LITERACY; AND (4) INFORMATION AND TECHNICAL LITERACY.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
THE STUDENT WILL BE ABLE TO:
1. APPLY GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES BY RECORDING TRANSACTION, ADJUSTING, CLOSING, AND REVERSING ENTRIES FOR SERVICE AND MERCHANDISING BUSINESSES. (1, 2)
2. ANALYZE ACCOUNTING DATA TO CALCULATE ASSET, LIABILITY, AND EQUITY VALUES FOR SOLE PROPRIETORSHIPS AND CORPORATIONS. (1, 4)
3. IDENTIFY SOUND MEASURES OF INTERNAL CONTROL. (1, 4)
4.CONSTRUCT FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND OTHER REPORTS FOR SOLE PROPRIETORSHIPS AND CORPORATIONS. (1, 2, 4)
5.INTEGRATE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS BY PRODUCING A HOMEWORK PORTFOLIO. (1, 2)
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
